column4: when I stop gdm to get into the console my system freezes with a black screen. I'm using gdm stop
don't stop gdm...use 'init 2'
but you can get into a console by pressing Alt-Ctl-F2 and you can get back into x again wwiht Alt-F7
a blank screen with what? init 2?
init 2 should force a reboot into a command line login prompt
does it reboot or just lock up?
right...you'll need sudo
oops...too many years in suse....you need init 1 and it will force single user mode. In ubuntu there is no non-X multiuser mode
but if you want such a login why not use Alt-Ctl-F2-F6....you can have five command prompts plus X running at once
what...init 2?
did it start a reboot or freeze before loading grub to restart?
sounds like a problem with shutdown. If you try to shutdown the computer from X does it shut down OK?
from the desktop, if you press Alt-Ctl-F2 do you get to a command prompt?
hmmm....might be an issue with the framebuffer driver for non-X video...haven't messed with Framebuffer in years
sounds like graphic (X) video works OK, but not the text mode...just the opposite of what everyone else complains about <smile>
I think you just need to type 'single' into the grub options line when it appears
but that I think forces a boot into runlevel 1 just like init 1 does...so will probably lock your system up
what is your screen resolution?
next time it boots, type 'vga=792' on the grub options line and then see if Alt-Ctl-F2 works
that will force 1024x768 for text mode
its gotta be these nvidia ddrivers.  the framebuffer worked fine at boot...
forcing 1024x768 didn't help?
